choices.C: nonroutable IP address assigned to the virtual interface
choices.E: preauth ACL to allow access to the external web server
choices.A: WLAN being not present in the default AP group

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
last go to BE

Selected Answer: CE
C. Nonroutable IP address assigned to the virtual interface: The virtual interface on the WLC must be configured with a nonroutable IP address (e.g., 1.1.1.1) to facilitate web authentication. This ensures that clients are redirected to the external web server for authentication.

E. Preauth ACL to allow access to the external web server: A preauthentication ACL (preauth ACL) must be configured to allow clients to access the external web server for authentication before they are granted full network access.

Why not the other options?
A. WLAN being not present in the default AP group: This is not required for web authentication configuration.

B. HTTPS redirection enabled: While HTTPS redirection can enhance security, it is not a mandatory requirement for external web authentication.

D. Web-auth secure web option enabled: This is optional and not required for basic external web authentication.

Thus, the two required elements are a nonroutable IP address assigned to the virtual interface and a preauth ACL to allow access to the external web server.

Selected Answer: DE
spoto answer DE
confused question , i go to CD

C and E. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/catalyst-9800-series-wireless-controllers/217457-configure-and-troubleshoot-external-web.html.
ACL is automatically created in 9800 but is required.

comments.content: I believe Minsait is correct. Per the packet flow diagram in the doc Minsait shared, the web communication between the client and WLC (GET and Redirect) is HTTP and not HTTPS. I think this rules out B & D and, option A doesn't seem relevant to the question.

questions.question_text: A WLAN on the WLC is configured for web authentication as the Layer 3 Security policy with the web-auth type External. Which two elements are required as part of the configuration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Clean Air is enabled: Cisco CleanAir is a feature that detects and mitigates RF interference, including jamming devices. Enabling CleanAir ensures that the wireless network can detect such devices.

D. Air Quality Index Trap is enabled: This feature sends SNMP traps when the air quality index (AQI) drops due to interference, such as from a jamming device. Enabling this ensures that alerts are raised when interference is detected.

Why not the other options?
A. Jammer is in the “Rogue Devices to Detect” multiple select box: This is not a specific configuration for detecting jamming devices.

B. Jammer is selected in the Rogue Policies: Rogue policies are for detecting rogue access points, not jamming devices.

E. Set the Cisco WLC to trap this type of device: This is not a specific configuration step for jamming devices.

Thus, the two required parameters are Clean Air is enabled and Air Quality Index Trap is enabled.

Selected Answer: CE
E: if you want the Cisco WLC to send an alarm when it detects a jamming device, check the Enable Interference Type Trap check box and move the jamming device to the Trap on These Types box.

C: Check the CleanAir check box to enable Cisco CleanAir functionality on the 802.11a/n or 802.11b/g/n network, or uncheck it to prevent the Cisco WLC from detecting spectrum interference. By default, this feature is in disabled state.
-Air Quality Enable by default
I believe Rogue Detection only works with-in 802.11 standards, so it would not be able to detect raw RF interference. Thus you are looking at Clean Air and some sort of trapping method to alert.

comments.content: I agree with GoldLeader. C and E are the correct answers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
CleanAir is required as that enables the AP chipset to detect interference. Then in 9800 you go to Configuration --> Radio Configurations --> CleanAir --> Select Trap Configuration --> Move Jammer to the Interference Types to trap box.

choices.E: Set the Cisco WLC to trap this type of device.
choices.D: Air Quality Index Trap is enabled.
choices.A: Jammer is in the “Rogue Devices to Detect” multiple select box.
choices.B: Jammer is selected in the Rogue Policies.

questions.question_text: An engineer manages a wireless network for an enterprise. The offices of the enterprise are in a multistory building with other companies. To avoid service loss of the wireless network, jamming devices must be monitored and an alert must be raised when one enters the airspace. Which two parameters must be configured for this alarm to happen? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Configure the internal WLC IP address on the OEAPs.

Explanation:
OEAPs are designed to connect to the internal IP address of the WLC, not the public IP address. Even though NAT is configured to map the public IP to the internal WLC IP, the OEAPs must be configured with the internal WLC IP address to establish a connection.

Why not the other options?
B. Create an ACL in WLC to accept the OEAPs: This is not necessary unless there are specific access restrictions, and it does not address the core issue of IP address configuration.

C. Enable NAT on the WLC to configure the public IP address: NAT is already configured on the security team's device, and the WLC does not need to handle NAT.

D. Configure the public WLC IP address on the home router: This is not required, as the OEAPs should be configured with the internal WLC IP address.

Thus, the correct action is to configure the internal WLC IP address on the OEAPs.

C: If your WLC does not have a publicly reachable IP then you need to have NAT IP where controller management IP is reachable. In that case you need to enable NAT on WLC management interface & map NAT IP on to it

Selected Answer: D
Cisco OEAPs are designed to work behind a router or other gateway device that is using network address translation (NAT). NAT allows a device, such as a router, to act as an agent between the Internet (public) and a personal network (private), enabling an entire group of computers to be represented by a single IP address.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-7/config-guide/b_cg87/m_configuring_officeextend_access_points.html#:~:text=Cisco%20OEAPs%20are,single%20IP%20address.
wouldnt this be B? A really badly worded question, with all answers being a bit odd

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Enabling NAT on the WLC to configure the public IP address would not resolve the issue because the security team has already configured NAT with a public IP address that points to the internal WLC IP address. Therefore, option C would not be the correct solution in this case.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct
C is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
C. You need to select the management interface on the WLC and click the NAT checkbox. Then enter the public NAT IP. In this case it would be the public NAT IP that the security team created. D. is incorrect. The users home internet router does not need any configuration.

questions.question_text: More people are working from home, so an engineer must configure OEAPs to support the users. The security team already configured NAT with a public IP address that points to the internal WLC IP address. The APs also have been configured with the public WLC IP address, but APs cannot join the controller yet. Which action resolves this issue?

choices.A: Configure the internal WLC IP address on the OEAPs.
choices.B: Create an ACL in WLC to accept the OEAPs.
choices.C: Enable NAT on the WLC to configure the public IP address.
choices.D: Configure the public WLC IP address on the home router.

questions.question_text: A network engineer is configuring a Cisco FlexConnect AP to allow Cisco ISE to dynamically assign the subnet of a user based on their credentials. Which controller mapping must be modified for this feature?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
AP group: The AP group configuration on the WLC determines the VLAN mappings for WLANs. By configuring the AP group to allow dynamic VLAN assignment, Cisco ISE can assign users to specific subnets (VLANs) based on their credentials.

Why not the other options?
A. WLAN VLAN: This is used for static VLAN assignment and does not support dynamic assignment by ISE.

B. VLAN ACL: This is used for access control and does not affect VLAN assignment.

C. RF group: This is used for radio frequency management and is unrelated to VLAN assignment.

Thus, the correct mapping to modify is the AP group to enable dynamic VLAN assignment by Cisco ISE.

According to AI A is correct 

The AP group configuration allows a network engineer to apply specific settings and policies to a group of access points. In this scenario, modifying the AP group would be necessary to enable the Cisco ISE to dynamically assign the subnet based on user credentials. By configuring the AP group, the network engineer can define the necessary parameters and policies for the FlexConnect AP to communicate with the Cisco ISE for dynamic subnet assignment.

Selected Answer: A
WLAN VLAN mapping is the answer. D. is incorrect there is no dynamic vlan configuration done there. You need to add the VLANs that you will dynamically assign to the WLAN VLAN mapping.

questions.question_text: An engineer must implement Video Stream on a Cisco Wireless Network for a single SSID deployment model. Which feature must be enabled on Cisco Catalyst 9800 Series WLC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This configuration example describes how to configure VideoStream (also known as MediaStream or Multicast-Direct) on a Catalyst 9800 Series Wireless Controllers (9800 WLC) through the Graphic User Interface (GUI).
To implement Video Stream on a Cisco Wireless Network for a single SSID deployment model, the feature that must be enabled on Cisco Catalyst 9800 Series WLC is C. IGMP Snooping.

Multicast Direct Admission Control

Multicast Direct Enable: you must enable this checkbox"
